info.name: Mastercard Authentication API
info.description:
Authentication API to lookup cardholder authentication methods, and bind and unbind token to device

Contact Support:
 Name: API Support
 Email: apisupport@mastercard.com

item.name: Bind MFA to card or consumer identifier

header.description: The X-Src-Cx-Flow-Id ensures to direct all calls from the same client to the same server and maintains session affinity. When you make your initial API call, Secure Card on File responds with the X-Src-Cx-Flow-Id in the header. The X-Src-Cx-Flow-Id returned in this response should be used in the subsequent calls to ensure these calls are directed to the same server that returned the initial response.

request.description: Provide a client with the means to bind a MFA method to a FPAN/srcDigitalCardId and/or consumer Identifier, e.g, email address, mobile number etc.

item.name: Delete MFA Method Instance by MFA Method Instance Id

header.description: The X-Src-Cx-Flow-Id ensures to direct all calls from the same client to the same server and maintains session affinity. When you make your initial API call, Secure Card on File responds with the X-Src-Cx-Flow-Id in the header. The X-Src-Cx-Flow-Id returned in this response should be used in the subsequent calls to ensure these calls are directed to the same server that returned the initial response.

query.description: (Required) Type of the MFA method instance identifier, use "INTERNAL" (Generated by Mastercard) for mfaMethodInstanceId, use "EXTERNAL" (Generated by Client) for externalMfaMethodInstanceId.
Client supplied unique identifier identifying the MFA Method Instance. Conditional – required if mfaMethodInstanceId not present.
Mastercard generated unique identifier identifying the MFA Method Instance. Conditional – required if externalMfaMethodInstanceId not present.
(Required) A unique identifier assigned by Mastercard during onboarding which signifies the responsible party Integrating to Mastercard Checkout Solutions (MCS).

Unique identifier for the entity verifying a person as an authorized cardholder using a Mastercard-approved Multi-factor Authentication method in a remote commerce token transaction. When provided, will be used to delete authenticator bindings verified using the provided Authenticating Entity.

A unique identifier that represents the token associated with a card enrolled into Mastercard Checkout Solutions (MCS). Use this srcDigitalCardId in subsequent checkout requests to retrieve a DSRP payload containing the associated token and cryptogram for payment authorization. Alternatively, use the srcDigitalCardId in a get card request to retrieve the maskedCard details.

request.description: The Delete MFA method instance operation will delete the MFA method instance corresponding the specified MFA Method Instance Id.
